name: Chand Baori

name: Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds)

name: The Root Bridges of Cherrapunji

name: Skeletons of Roopkund Lake

name: Jal Mahal
ao_description: More than half of this Indian palace is drowned but it looks all the more spectacular for it.

name: The Blue City of Jodhpur

name: Shatrunjaya Hill

name: Mahabat Maqbara

name: The Great Wall of India

name: Hampi

name: Hanuman’s Temple
ao_description: Sacred Indian temple that’s all monkey business.

name: Nek Chand Saini's Rock Garden

name: Jantar Mantar

name: Ajanta Caves

name: Great Banyan Tree

name: Golden Temple

name: Bahá'í Lotus Temple

name: Meenakshi Amman Temple

name: Mysore Palace

name: Cafe Lota

name: Mahabodhi Temple

name: Antilia

ao_description: Ornate, dome-topped cenotaphs fill this royal crematorium.

name: Pratapgad Fort

name: Terreti Bazaar
ao_description: For just a few hours each morning, this market serves specialties from the city's shrinking Chinese-Indian community.

name: Terreti Bazaar
ao_description: For just a few hours each morning, this market serves specialties from the city's shrinking Chinese-Indian community.

ao_description: A once-stately trading fort is now a ruin slowly being consumed by the sea.

ao_description: A tribute to one of Bombay's former governors that has withstood the test of time.

name: Smith's Folly
ao_description: This cupola was once seen as an architectural disaster.

name: Razia Sultan Tomb
ao_description: Delhi's only female ruler is buried in this neglected, forgotten tomb.

name: St. Thomas Cathedral
ao_description: Located in the Horniman Circle area, this church marks the historical Zero Point of Mumbai.

name: Banyan Tree Arch
ao_description: An old tree within the university grounds has formed a beautiful archway that looks like a magical portal.

name: Bandra Fort
ao_description: Designed as a 17th-century watchtower, the former fort is now a popular sunset haunt.

name: Raja Ices
ao_description: Pune's oldest ice cream parlor serves scoops in flavors like lemongrass.

name: The Old Water Tower
ao_description: More than a century old, this heritage water tower is located in the middle of the high-rises of Pune.

name: Thiba Palace
ao_description: This palace was built for the last king of Myanmar.

name: Cheraman Juma Masjid
ao_description: Inside India's oldest mosque, a lamp is said to have burnt for 1,000 years without going out.

name: The Arch of Conception
ao_description: One of the few surviving gates into Old Goa, the former capital of Portuguese India.

name: Church of Our Lady of the Rosary
ao_description: Considered one of the oldest surviving churches in Goa.

name: Losel Doll Museum
ao_description: The art and tradition of Tibetan costumes are preserved through these dolls made by Buddhist monks.

name: Reis Magos Fort
ao_description: A nearly impregnable 16th-century fort is one of Goa's oldest.

name: Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum
ao_description: A collection of over 20,000 priceless artifacts collected by a single person over several decades.

name: Memorial Stupa of Helena Roerich
ao_description: Outside a hilltop monastery in India, a monument to a 20th-century Russian mystic.

name: Leo Tolstoy Monument, Janpath
ao_description: A commemoration of the little-known cultural influence that Tolstoy had on India.

name: Statues of Medici Lions
ao_description: Four Medici Lions guard a heritage old stone bridge that was constructed in 1867.

name: Har Ki Pauri
ao_description: The Hindu god Vishnu is said to have walked at this Hindu pilgrimage site.

name: ARAI Hill Stone Quarry
ao_description: Natural walking trails around this abandoned hilltop stone quarry offer nature enthusiasts fantastic views of the city.

name: World War I Memorial
ao_description: An obelisk designed in memory of the soldiers from the city and district who fought in The Great War.

name: Shree Ganesh Darshan Museum
ao_description: Located within a temple complex, this museum has a fantastic collection of around 500 idols of Lord Ganesh.

name: Nana Wada
ao_description: A combination of Peshwa and British Gothic Revival architecture.

name: Arulmigu Kulasai Mutharamman Temple
ao_description: Every year, massive crowds flock to this 300-year-old temple to celebrate a unique, goddess-centric Hindu festival.

name: Café Goodluck
ao_description: This local institution has been serving Parsi staples since 1935.

name: Port Trust War Memorial
ao_description: A sandstone lamp post in Mumbai's business district honors the war efforts of the Port Trust and its employees who fell during World War I.

name: Underground Tunnel at Mastani Lake
ao_description: Once a passageway that led to the Shaniwar Wada palace fort.

name: The Wall of Amer
ao_description: An ancient wall in the shadows of the Amber Castle.

name: Statue of Jhalkaribai
ao_description: Dedicated to the life of a brave woman soldier.

name: Sapindya Mahadev Temple
ao_description: An ancient temple of Lord Shiva was rediscovered in an excavation in 2003.

name: Narayan Darwaja
ao_description: One of the five gates into the fortress of to Shaniwar Wada was renamed to commemorate the 10th Peshwa of the Maratha Empire.

name: Ghanta Ghar
ao_description: The clock tower is a prominent landmark in the bustling commercial hub in the heart of Jodhpur, showcasing intricate architecture and cultural significance.

name: Nagarkar Wada
ao_description: A 19th-century mansion with a Gothic entrance in the center of Pune.

name: Army & Navy Building
ao_description: This 19th-century heritage building once housed a department store that supplied British provisions in the city.

name: Ohel David Synagogue
ao_description: Said to be the largest synagogue built in India.

name: Pune Nagar Vachan Mandir
ao_description: The oldest library in Pune.

name: Ima Market
ao_description: Established in the 16th century, this "mother's market" is run entirely by women.

name: The Statue of Bajirao Peshwa
ao_description: Dedicated to one of the greatest military minds of the Maratha Empire.

name: The Memorial of Nanasaheb Peshwa
ao_description: A tribute to the man who helped develop Pune.

name: Crypt at Se Cathedral
ao_description: A mysterious burial crypt that was rediscovered inside a cathedral in Velha Goa.

name: Old Woman’s Shoe
ao_description: A gigantic shoe, inspired by a nursery rhyme, sits in a park atop Mumbai’s Malabar Hill.

name: Hissar Fort Stairs
ao_description: One of the last few remnants of an ancient fort which once stood in the oldest area of Pune.

name: Twelve Pound Howitzer
ao_description: In the courtyard of a popular museum stands a piece of artillery from 1859.

name: Maratha War Memorial
ao_description: A stone monument dedicated to Indian soldiers who fought and died for the British Indian Army during World War I.

name: Anandashram Sanstha
ao_description: A historic organization dedicated towards the preservation of Sanskrit texts.

name: Zero Stone of Pune
ao_description: One in a series of historical markers from the massive 19th-century undertaking to map all of India.

name: Sevasi Vav
ao_description: This 500-year-old stepwell descends seven levels deep into the ground.

name: Old Goa Cemetery
ao_description: This cemetery in Velha Goa was once the site of several historical religious buildings.

name: University Tunnel
ao_description: This 300-foot-long underground tunnel was once used to transport food from the kitchen into the main building.

name: Kala Ghoda Statue
ao_description: A tribute to the area's namesake and King Edward VII.

name: Eran Pillar of Goparaja
ao_description: India's oldest sati stone, attributed to an otherwise unknown king of the ancient Gupta Empire.

name: Fort Aguada Jail Museum
ao_description: A former prison within a seaside fort has now been turned into an interactive museum.

name: Museum of Christian Art
ao_description: Located within a 17th-century convent, this museum features centuries-old Christian art pieces that meld European and Asian influences.

name: Bhausaheb Rangari Bhavan Museum
ao_description: A 19th-century house filled with secret trap doors and hidden basements has been turned into a museum.

name: The Nizam's Guest House
ao_description: This stately building once housed the office of the university for a brief period of time.

name: Pune’s First Lift
ao_description: The vintage, artistic cage of the city’s first lift welcomes visitors to an old heritage building.

name: Dharohar: National Museum of Customs & GST
ao_description: A collection of items seized by the Indian Customs have been kept for display at the Old Customs House in Panaji.

name: Emblems of the Erstwhile Governors
ao_description: These stone carvings represent the various governors that once ruled Mumbai.

name: Parvati Hill Chapha Tree
ao_description: Said to be the oldest tree in Pune.

name: The Modak and The Mount Street Lamps
ao_description: Artistic streetlamps depicting Lord Ganesh’s favourite food and divine mount around an iconic temple of the deity in the heart of Pune.

name: Shree Nageshwar Shiva Temple
ao_description: This 700-year-old temple is one of the city's oldest.

name: Convent of the Discalced Carmelites
ao_description: The ruins of a 17th-century Carmelite Convent atop a hill in Old Goa.

name: Gate of St. Paul's College
ao_description: All that remains of a 16th-century Jesuit school is this carved, worn gate.

name: Dona Paula's Tombstone
ao_description: Legends of adultery, love affairs, and charity swirl around this mysterious 17th-century Portuguese woman.

name: Servants of India Society Monument
ao_description: A hilltop stone monument commemorating the establishment of a historic social welfare organization.

name: Blades of Glory Cricket Museum
ao_description: Believed to be the largest cricket museum in the world.

name: Tomb of Ishtur Phakda
ao_description: The final resting place of a British officer killed during the First Anglo-Maratha War.

name: Lal Mahal
ao_description: A historic palace in the center of Pune where the founder of the Maratha Empire spent his formative years.

name: The Old Gate of Vaibhaveshwar Navagraha Temple
ao_description: On the Mutha riverbank near the center of Pune stands a centuries-old temple with a fascinating old stone entrance.

name: Museum of Cartoon Art
ao_description: On the university grounds, this unique museum is dedicated to cartoons and their importance in society.

name: The Chapel of St. Catherine
ao_description: This chapel was built by Afonso de Albuquerque in 1510 to commemorate his entry into the city of Goa on St. Catherine’s Day.

name: Tulshibaug Ram Temple
ao_description: The 18th-century temple was once the tallest structure in Pune, and surrounded by a garden of tulsi.

name: Maruti Temple
ao_description: An iconic temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman resides atop a hill in the heart of Panaji.

name: Amruteshwar Siddheshwar Temple Complex
ao_description: A cluster of 18th-century temples with an underground shrine.

name: Kirkee War Cemetery
ao_description: This neatly maintained cemetery honors the sacrifice of the brave soldiers who laid down their lives during World War I and World War II.

name: Fort Aguada Lighthouse
ao_description: A modern lighthouse near Fort Aguada offers stunning views of the surrounding peninsula.

name: The Letterbox With a Crown
ao_description: In the premises of Pune Head Post Office stands a curious letterbox topped with the design of a crown.

name: Collection of Old Engraved Stones
ao_description: An open-air collection of historical stones with engravings and inscriptions in Old Goa.

name: University Stone Quarry Lake
ao_description: Now a small lake, stone quarried from this spot was used to build the local university building.

name: Chapel of Our Lady of the Mount
ao_description: This 16th-century hilltop chapel is one of the oldest churches in Old Goa.

name: The Old Archiepiscopal Palace
ao_description: In Old Goa, the former residence of the archbishop now houses a permanent exhibition.

name: The Convent of St. Dominic's Cross
ao_description: The only surviving relic of the abandoned Dominican convent.

name: Casa da Moeda
ao_description: The erstwhile Portuguese Era mint house of Goa.

name: Parvati Nandan Ganpati Temple
ao_description: This 17th-century temple gave the area of Ganeshkhind its name.

name: Ponte de Linhares Causeway
ao_description: Believed to have been the longest bridge in the world when it was completed in 1634.

name: Mandovi Memorial Cross
ao_description: Dedicated to the victims of a tragic ferry disaster in Goa.

name: Casa de Polvora Millstones
ao_description: The millstones of an ancient Portuguese gunpowder factory have been kept on display at Old Goa.

name: Statue of Abbe Faria
ao_description: In the heart of Panaji, a monument to the pioneer of modern hypnotism.

name: Gaspar Dias Fort Cannon
ao_description: This cannon was part of a 16th-century fort near Miramar Beach in Panaji.

name: Ribandar Riverside Viewpoint Cross
ao_description: This cross marks the site of a 16th-century Portuguese gunpowder factory.
